availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
The State of California
City & County of
Sacramento. } S.S.

I William G. English duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner for the State of Kentucky resident at the City of Sacramento, County of Sacramento and State of California do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner under and by virtue of the laws of said State of Kentucky.
Sworn to, & Subscribed before me this 2d day of January A.D. 1862.

Jared Irwin Co. Clerk Sac. County
By John S. Barrett, Dep. Co. Clk

California
Comr of Deeds
W. G. English
Oath Filed
Apr 30. 1862
